trial_identification.studytitle: Rituximab in Combination With Outpatient Therapy for CD20+ Lymphoma
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Pilot Study of Rituximab in Combination With Out-patient Based VGF/F-GIV Salvage Therapies for Relapsed/Refractory CD20+ Lymphomas

primaryOutcome.outcome: To evaluate the safety of a risk-adjusted outpatient-based approach to lymphoma salvage therapy with VGF and/or F-GIV in combination with Rituximab.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: To determine point estimates of the response rates achieved with R-VGF or R-F-GIV in previously treated patients with relapsed/refractory CD20+ B-cell NHL.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Age >18 years
- Relapsed or primary refractory CD20+ NHL
- ECOG 0 - 2
- Written informed consent
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Intention to proceed with any form of transplant therapy following fewer than 2 cycles of protocol salvage therapy.
- Bilirubin > 50Âµmol/litre unless secondary to lymphoma
- Creatinine > 2 x upper limit of normal unless secondary to lymphoma
- Absolute neutrophil count <0.5 x 109/litre and / or platelets < 50 x 109/litre unless secondary to lymphoma
- Relapse within 6 months of a prior transplant procedure (autologous or allogeneic).
- Known sensitivity to E coli derived preparations

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a Phase II pilot study evaluating the safety of a risk-adjusted outpatient-based approach to lymphoma salvage therapy with VGF (vinorelbine, gemcitabine and pegfilgrastim) and/or F-GIV (gemcitabine, Ifosfamide, vinorelbine and pegfilgrastim) in combination with Rituximab (R-VGF/R-F-GIV).
